jobs.title: Commercial and Strategic Partnerships Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Shega is building the definitive information, data, and intelligence hub for Ethiopia, Africa, and other emerging markets. Our hybrid model combines:

  1. Product-led Platform – Free/ Paid Media, Information and Insights Platform, and an AI-powered data and intelligence layer that aggregates clean economic, corporate, and alternative datasets; a conversational analytics interface; and

  2. Strategic Services – Bespoke research & advisory, market scans, sector briefs, and an Advertising agency service that translates insights into action through end-to-end strategy, creative content, marketing campaigns, and performance optimization for corporates, Development organizations, investors, and high-growth startups.

Together, these two pillars give decision-makers trusted content reach, standardized data, and hands-on expertise—a one-stop shop for turning information into execution. Backing from partners like the Gates Foundation, and a fast-growing team of researchers, engineers, and storytellers, we sit at the intersection of data, media, and execution—turning fragmented information into decisions that move markets. Our mission is simple: empower Africa’s innovators, investors, and policymakers with clarity and confidence to build the future.

Your Mandate

As Commercial & Strategic Partnerships Lead, you will:

  1. Grow strategic-service revenue — package and sell research, advisory, and Agency services that unlock client value.

  2. Scale product revenue — drive subscriptions, enterprise licences, and data partnerships for the platform.

  3. Forge ecosystem alliances — sourcing, structuring, and expanding high-value partnerships that deepen product capability, increase distribution, and unlock new markets.

The role sits at the intersection of sales leadership, business development, and ecosystem building and is pivotal to turning Shega’s differentiated distribution and data assets into sustainable, scalable revenue streams.

Core Responsibilities

Focus Area: Commercial Strategy & Revenue Leadership

What Success Looks Like

  • Translate company vision into annual/quarterly commercial OKRs and GTM plans.

  • Design monetization models for each product line (media, Agency business, Insights & Advisory, data subscriptions).

  • Own forecasting, pipeline health, pricing discipline, and deal governance.

Focus Area: Partnership Development & Management

What Success Looks Like

  • Identify and negotiate strategic alliances with corporates, DFIs, development orgs, data providers, and distribution platforms.

  • Build “Partner & Enterprise Solutions” packages that combine Shega data + content + advisory to solve partner pain-points and design multiyear donor projects

  • Manage partner onboarding, joint-goals, and quarterly business reviews.

Focus Area: Integrated GTM & Distribution

What Success Looks Like

  • Leverage Shega’s own channels ( Publication, Newsletters, Business Minute, SEM) and bought channels to maximize reach and conversion

  • Work with Product, Content & Media teams to turn audience insights into targeted campaigns and funnel programmes (“distribution is king”)

Focus Area: Team & Process Leadership

What Success Looks Like

  • Build and coach a high-performance Commercial & Partnerships team (sales, account management, partner success).

  • Implement revenue-ops tooling (CRM, playbooks, dashboards) and data-driven decision-making routines.

Focus Area: Market Intelligence & Feedback Loop

What Success Looks Like

  • Continuously scan the market for emerging needs (fintech, digital economy, impact projects) and feed insights back to Product & Editorial for roadmap prioritisation.

  • Represent Shega at industry events, panels, and in high-level stakeholder engagements.

Key Performance Indicators

Revenue

  • Total contract value (TCV) / ARR closed

  • Quarterly new-logo deals

  • Renewal & expansion rate

Partnership Impact

  • # of strategic MoUs signed

  • Donor/Partner-generated revenue

  • Co-marketing / co-innovation outputs

Pipeline & Efficiency

  • Pipeline coverage ratio

  • Average sales-cycle length

  • Win rate

Team & Culture

  • Team quota attainment

  • Employee engagement score

  • Adherence to Shega values

Ideal Candidate Profile

Experience & Expertise

  • 6–8 yrs in B2B commercial leadership, business development, or strategic partnerships within media, SaaS/data platforms, or advisory/consulting; African or emerging-market exposure essential.

  • Proven track record of closing complex, multi-stakeholder deals (six-figure USD+).

  • Deep network across fintech, development finance institutions, corporates, and tech ecosystems in Africa.

Skills & Competencies

  • Strategic thinker with strong financial modelling and deal-structuring skills.

  • Exceptional relationship-builder and negotiator—able to influence C-suite and policymakers.

  • Data-literate: comfortable using analytics to drive decisions and tell the commercial story.

  • Team builder who scales processes and inspires high performance.

Culture & Values Fit

  • Resonates with Shega’s mission of empowering decision-making in Africa through data & insight.

  • Operates with integrity, long-term thinking, and a bias for execution.

  • Thrives in fast-growing, resource-constrained environments and enjoys building from 0 → 1.

First 90-Day Expectations (Snapshot)

Timeline and Milestones

30 Days

  • Deep dive into existing funnels, active deals, and partner landscape.

  • Align on FY targets & prioritise top 10 opportunities.

60 Days

  • Publish commercial playbook (ICP, value props, pricing, contracting).

  • Advance at least three strategic partnership/Clients negotiations to signing stage

90 Days

  • Close first marquee deal demonstrating combined data + media value.

  • Deliver a board-level update outlining revenue road-map and resourcing plan.

Why Shega?

Shega sits at a unique nexus of trusted media reach, proprietary datasets, and AI-powered intelligence. You will own the mandate to monetise that platform and forge partnerships that shape how businesses, investors, and policymakers navigate Africa’s rapid transformation.

Ready to drive continent-shaping impact? We’d love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Chief Technology Officer (CTO) - AI & Intelligence
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Company

Shega is building Africa’s and Emerging Markets Leading Intelligence Platform — a product that enables decision-makers across business, finance, and development sectors to access trustworthy, contextual, and AI-powered data and insights. Think of it as a Bloomberg + Palantir, purpose-built for Africa and other emerging markets.

We operate at the intersection of data, media, and intelligence. Our platform combines:

  • Clean, standardized economic and business data

  • AI-powered tools for querying, forecasting, and interpreting trends

  • A real-time content engine that contextualizes market events and news

We're backed by trusted partners (e.g., Gates Foundation) and work with leading Companies, DFIs, investors, and startups. This is a chance to build core infrastructure for how the continent and beyond make decisions.

Why This Role Matters

Africa is experiencing a data and decision-making revolution — but existing solutions are fragmented, outdated, or not built for the unique challenges of low-resource, complex economies. We need a CTO who can imagine, design, and build a world-class AI and data infrastructure for the continent and beyond.

This is not just a “VP of Engineering” role. As CTO, you’ll shape Shega’s technical DNA, lead the architecture and AI roadmap, and build the team and systems that power a scalable, intelligence-first platform from the ground up.

Key Responsibilities

1. Technical Leadership

  • Design and own the technical architecture of the platform, including ingestion, processing, and delivery of structured and unstructured data (APIs, NLP, dashboards, chat, etc.)

  • Lead the development of AI and ML infrastructure to power natural language querying, forecasting, and anomaly detection

  • Oversee real-time intelligence systems, data cleaning pipelines, and personalization engines

  • Ensure robust, scalable, and secure infrastructure for both enterprise and mid-market use

2. Product Collaboration

  • Work closely with the CEO and product team to co-create the platform’s core functionality and roadmap

  • Design for usability, extensibility, and low-bandwidth / low-resource environments

  • Champion experimentation, iteration, and smart MVP thinking

3. Team Building & Culture

  • Hire and mentor a top-tier engineering and data science team

  • Create clear processes for execution, QA, deployment, and learning

  • Cultivate a culture of excellence, pragmatism, and long-term thinking

4. Strategic & External Engagement

  • Collaborate with institutional partners and clients on technical integration or bespoke deployments

  • Represent Shega in technical partnerships, speaking engagements, and conferences as needed

  • Shape Shega’s AI and ethical data governance principles

Who You Are

You don’t just write code — you think like a builder, strategist, and long-term owner. You’ve seen what great looks like and want to build systems that last, especially in underserved but high-potential contexts like Africa or similar emerging markets

Must-Have Skills

  • 8+ years of experience in software engineering, with 3+ in a technical leadership role

  • Experience with AI/ML systems, particularly in NLP, time-series forecasting, or knowledge graph architecture

  • Deep experience in building scalable, cloud-based data infrastructure (ETL, analytics engines, APIs)

  • Comfortable working in ambiguous, zero-to-one environments

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills — you translate complexity clearly

Bonus

  • Experience in emerging markets or building for Africa

  • Familiarity with business decisions on low-resource language models or inclusive tech design

  • Prior founder, early-stage startup, or product-technical hybrid experience

  • Research publications, patents, open-source contributions, or community leadership in the AI/data space

What We Offer

  • A unique opportunity to define the data infrastructure of an entire continent

  • High ownership, zero bureaucracy, and direct access to mission-critical decision-making

  • Competitive salary and founder-level equity

  • Backed by serious partners but moving with startup speed

jobs.title: Sales Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
The Company

Serengeti Spirits is a startup brand and manufacturer of craft-produced alcoholic spirits based on all the big animals of the Serengeti and across many different spirit types. All our products are flavoured with the tropical flavours resonant with the fruits found on the paradise of Zanzibar Island. Our products are filled with exciting flavours such as mango, passion fruit, coconut & banana. They are then encapsulated in our custom-shaped bottles, hand-painted animal head caps and Serengeti-themed labels.

We have a range of very striking and unique products to bring to market. We have an office in Tanzania and will be looking to export to a range of international markets, along with selling across the UK and Europe, via our new DTC website and by building connections with distributors. The company has ambitious plans to expand into RTD beverages through its sub-brand ‘Big 5’. We have an ambitious 5-year road map that, if we can implement correctly, will lead to us having a vast range of products, sold via a variety of avenues, all over the world.

Our micro distillery is based in a converted outbuilding at a large country house in the village of Braunston, in Northamptonshire. United Kingdom.

The Role

We are seeking a highly motivated and ambitious individual with a background in sales, who is ready to begin a journey and exciting challenge to help get our business up and running. This will be the first full-time sales job hire within the company, so the successful applicant will be working alongside the owner and will be part of growing the team, regarding future staff and the business in general.

The role will be supported by additional part-time staff, both in the UK and Tanzania. The job will be 100% remote and based on outcome, and not tied to working hours and days. The successful applicant will need to assist in all areas of sales of our product range. This will include E-commerce sales outlets, retail, wholesale, via on-trade and off-trade and assisting the company on its export journey outside of the UK and expanding into international markets.

Responsibilities include (but are not limited to): 

  • To generate sales for the company, both in the UK & abroad. 

  • Build business relationships with prospective customers from a variety of different sales channels and areas, such as bar/restaurants, travel retail outlets & distributors. 

  • Manage the whole end-to-end sales process from generating the lead, to the after-sales service, once the product has arrived to the customer. 

  • Work closely with the new marketing manager to grow the brand and ensure that our marketing activities are supporting sales growth 

  • Any ad hoc requirements that may come as part of being a new company.

Qualifications: 

  • MUST be fluent in written & spoken English, with a persona that matches that of the company brand (information on our website)

  • Required to be very hardworking and determined. Working in a start-up company in this field will require lots of dedication and patience. 

  • Experience of working in a sales role, ideally in retail, wholesale & export. Experience in the drinks industry is desirable. 

  • Tech-savvy and must be able to make use of a range of sales and automation tools. As a small company, we need to be resourceful. 

  • Self-motivated, ambitious, and interested in growing with an exciting start-up company. Interest in Spirits, cocktails & mixers is preferable.

    • Must want to progress within the business as the business expands. 

  • Friendly and personable to build business relationships as the ‘face’ of the company and to work as part of our ‘family team’. 

  • Must be very well presented, spoken and sociable, as the role will require networking and projecting the company in the premium segment of the market.

Further company information can be seen here: www.serengetispirits.com, https://www.linkedin.com/in/alexwright4/

Salary to be determined on the expertise and experience of the applicant and will be a combination of a fixed consultancy fee and commission.

Start date: ASAP

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About PipeOps:

PipeOps is an all-in-one DevOps platform that lets engineering teams deploy, monitor, and scale applications on their cloud in minutes (no DevOps expertise required). Backed by Techstars, we power startups and SMBs alike to go from code to cloud with intuitive automation, a Git-push workflow, and built-in support for AWS, GCP, and Azure.

Role Overview:

We’re seeking a Senior Software Engineer specialised in Go (Golang) to drive our core backend services and platform features. You’ll work closely with product and marketing teams to build scalable microservices, improve developer workflows, and ensure high performance across our cloud control plane.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, implement, and maintain backend services and APIs in Go for pipelines and orchestration features

  • Collaborate on system architecture, performance tuning, and scaling strategies for container-based workloads

  • Drive end-to-end development: from prototyping and API design to testing, deployment, and monitoring

  • Own CI/CD pipelines, and observability (Prometheus, Grafana)

  • Mentor junior engineers, conduct code reviews, and contribute to best practices around testing, documentation, and security

  • Partner with product and UX teams to translate requirements into maintainable Go modules and SDKs

Must-Have Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of professional software engineering experience, with 2+ years of heavy use of Go in production

  • Deep understanding of Go internals, concurrency patterns (goroutines, channels), and idiomatic code structure

  • Proven track record building RESTful APIs and GRPC services at scale

  • Good experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and modern cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure)

  • Strong debugging and performance-profiling skills; familiarity with tracing tools (e.g. Jaeger, OpenTelemetry)

  • Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset in a remote, cross-functional team

Preferred Skills:

  • Exposure to event-driven architectures (Kafka or RabbitMQ).

  • Knowledge of security best practices for cloud-native applications.

jobs.title: Business Development Lead (Enterprise Payments)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Global enterprises entering African markets face a critical challenge: enabling millions of customers to pay using local payment methods they trust and can access. Streaming services, social media platforms, ride-hailing apps, and e-commerce marketplaces all struggle with the same problem – how to collect payments and make payouts efficiently across diverse African markets where mobile money, local cards, and region-specific banking systems dominate.

HoneyCoin solves this through our comprehensive payment processing infrastructure, empowering global enterprises to seamlessly accept payments and disburse funds using local methods across Africa, with connections expanding into the US, UK & Europe.

We want to keep earning trust, while also continuing to amaze our users with the use-cases HoneyCoin's infrastructure can power. This is where you come in — to help us expand our Enterprise Payments business by developing relationships with global B2C and B2B2C companies, implementing payment solutions tailored to their specific use cases, and establishing HoneyCoin as the essential payment infrastructure provider for any enterprise doing business in Africa.

Why Join

As a small team, we work in a highly collaborative environment and you'll have the opportunity to participate in every part of the business from idea to production.

  • What you'll get:

    • Impact: Build our Enterprise Payments division, securing partnerships with global brands that will bring our payment solutions to millions of users across Africa.

    • Excellence: Practice your craft with other professionals in a well-organized, fast-paced environment.

    • Ownership: Influence the direction of our enterprise payment products and strategy — we care about your opinions.

    • Fun: Working in a start up can be hard, but we make it real fun and definitely worth your while.

    • Growth: We compensate and reward our technical talent at above market rates both now and into the future because we believe that the people solving really hard problems every single day should feel equally as valued.

  • You'll be joining a young, high-growth company at the beginning of an incredible journey and will get to help shape a product that people absolutely love

  • You'll work alongside brilliant people who care deeply about the experiences of others: customers, colleagues, and partners

  • You'll have the autonomy to do the best work of your career, and also the support of peers who are genuinely invested in your growth

Key Responsibilities

  • Core duties:

    • Develop and execute business development strategies to acquire enterprise clients (global B2C and B2B2C businesses) seeking payment solutions for African markets

      • An enterprise client is a business such as TikTok, Netflix, Carrefour, Nestle, Uber, or Coca Cola who have large collection and disbursement needs.

    • Target specific verticals, including streaming services, social media platforms, digital advertisers, ride-hailing apps, e-commerce, and SaaS companies

    • Design tailored payment solutions addressing use cases such as subscription billing, in-app purchases, digital advertising payments, marketplace transactions, and driver/delivery payouts

    • Build relationships with C-suite executives and payment decision-makers at global enterprises

    • Implement complex payment integrations, working with client technical teams and our product/engineering department

    • Create and optimize payment flows for different business models (subscriptions, one-time purchases, marketplace payouts, etc.)

    • Develop a deep understanding of enterprise clients' payment needs, customer bases, and market expansion strategies

    • Negotiate enterprise agreements, pricing structures, and service level agreements

    • Coordinate with product and engineering teams to enhance our enterprise payment APIs and dashboards based on client feedback

    • Represent HoneyCoin at industry events, conferences, and forums related to global payments and African markets

    • Monitor competitive landscape and continuously evolve our enterprise payment offerings to maintain market leadership

Qualifications

  • Required experience & skills:

    • 7+ years of experience in enterprise sales, business development, or partnership management within payment processing, payment gateways, or financial technology

    • Proven track record of closing deals with global enterprise clients (B2C or B2B2C businesses)

    • Deep understanding of payment processing systems, including collections and payouts via mobile money, card networks, and banking systems

    • Experience with multiple payment use cases such as subscription billing, marketplace payments, in-app purchases, or advertising payments

    • Strong knowledge of African payment ecosystems, including mobile money platforms (M-Pesa, MTN Mobile Money, etc.), local card schemes, and bank transfer systems

    • Relationships with immediately ready-to-approach enterprise clients seeking payment solutions for African markets

    • Understanding of integration requirements for payment APIs and SDKs within enterprise environments

    • Familiarity with regulatory compliance requirements for payment processing, including AML, KYC, and cross-border transfer regulations

    • Experience with enterprise contract negotiations, pricing structures, and service agreements

    • Outstanding presentation, communication, and relationship-building abilities

    • Data-driven approach to identifying opportunities and measuring business development success

    • Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Technology, or related field; This is nice to have but not a requirement; we are big believers in proof of work and track record and care very little about credentials.

⛔Do not apply if:

  • You do not have direct experience selling payment solutions to enterprise-level clients (companies with global reach and large customer bases)

  • You are a junior or mid-level business development professional, we are not looking for candidates who are building their network and looking for a challenge; we're looking for seasoned professionals with established relationships at global enterprises. We have previously had cases where we bring on BD talent with no closed leads over an 8-week period, this is not something we're looking to repeat.

  • You lack an understanding of the specific payment challenges enterprises face when entering emerging markets

  • You have never worked with mobile money systems, local card processors, or other payment methods prevalent in African markets

  • You do not have a ready pipeline of possible enterprise leads to close, we're not looking for candidates who will be coming in to focus on building a pipeline from scratch

We provide reasons not to apply in order to save yours and our time as part of our interview process.

Employment at HoneyCoin is based on individual merit. Opportunities are open to all, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, creed, age, handicap, national origin, ancestry, military status, veteran status, medical condition, marital status, sexual orientation, affectional preference, or other irrelevant factors. HoneyCoin is an equal opportunity employer.

jobs.title: Senior Back-End Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
HoneyCoin’s mission is nothing short of building the infrastructural layer for the transfer of value for the future. We're starting by building the next-generation blockchain-based financial layer through our products, Honeycoin and Hive. If you're into next-level infrastructure at a large scale, read on!

Thousands of people use HoneyCoin and dozens of businesses — all moving millions of dollars across Africa, the US, UK & some parts of Europe, with this number increasing every day. That means all of these people trust us to deliver a fast, reliable, and secure experience, and we value this more than anything. We want to keep earning trust, while also continuing to amaze our users with the use cases HoneyCoin’s infrastructure can power. This is where you come in — to help us build scalable, performant, back-end infrastructure that works seamlessly with our front-end systems.

Why join

As a small team, we work in a highly collaborative environment, and you'll have the opportunity to participate in every part of the business from idea to production.

  • Impact: Build the foundation and shape engineering practices, team, and company culture.

  • Excellence: Practice your craft with other ICs in a well-organized, fast-paced environment.

  • Ownership: Influence the direction of product and strategy — we care about your opinions.

  • Fun: Working in a start-up can be hard, but we make it really fun and definitely worth your while.

What you'll do

We're looking for an experienced individual contributor who enjoys working alongside other experienced engineers and designers to quickly build and iterate on backend/API/platform.

  • Build the time layer for the Internet. You'll build the infrastructure for Cron from the ground up, having a huge and direct impact by shipping your work to users on prod daily.

  • Use modern web tech and influence the stack. The frontend is Angular, the backend Node/Express, and we use TypeScript across the full stack. As we build out our stack, you get to make critical choices and lay the foundations. You’ll be working on the GCP platform, and with technologies like Firebase Firestore, CRON jobs.

  • Self-direct your work and co-own the product. You're a technical founder type and will have autonomy and responsibility. You'll be involved in shaping the roadmap and will own HoneyCoin’s exploding backend needs.

  • Create a robust and scalable backend. Good understanding of database (Relational Or NoSQL) internals like transactions, indexes. Schema design will be a huge part of your workflow. Build performant REST API with Rediscache, delta sync, and offline support using IndexedDB, 3rd party integrations, product analytics, transactional email, and service monitoring. We currently deploy to Heroku to keep DevOps simple and will be looking for you to establish viable long-term cloud infrastructure and operations.

  • Build UI components. You'll implement basic UI based on Figma mocks and our design system. You'll collaborate with designers and frontend engineers on user-facing features powered by your backend code. We rapidly ship UI that has a native feel to it by polishing CSS, interaction states and animations.

  • Solve interesting technical problems. Bring your full creativity to solve super-challenging technical problems: from complex backend architecture with 3rd party integrations, syncing app state, to real-time collaboration.

What we're looking for

You're a senior IC that has built such systems before, and this is not an area you have to ramp up on. We don't require any formal qualifications but value learning new skills — especially from one another. We are looking for someone who feels a sense of duty to the users of their work.

  • Highly productive while producing quality code. You enjoy pushing out features in a pragmatic and maintainable way. You know when to use duct tape and when to lay a foundation.

  • Solid experience. 4+ years of experience building backend API’s on Node.js is a strong bonus. Working with the GCP platform, Node/Express backend and with technologies like Firebase Firestore, CRON jobs, and Docker would be an added benefit.

  • Curious and quick learning. We don't expect you to have experience in every technology we use, but to learn and be productive quickly. Owning several repos and jumping into all of them doesn't scare you.

  • Design sensibility. While you'll co-craft the interface with top designers and frontend engineers, we expect you to have a knack for great UX, such that you feel if something is off and can flag it, or better yet, polish it.

  • Attention to detail while pragmatic. We strive for few slips in code, Git hygiene, and clear written communication — all while remaining low-ego and simply focusing on solutions.

  • Interested in productivity apps/systems. You might use your calendar to time block, try out Chrome extensions, configure custom app launchers, or self-optimize in other ways.

  • Good heart. We don't tolerate jerks and are generally just friendly people.

What we offer (compensation & benefits)

We'll treat you well. If there are any other benefits that are important to you, we'd like to hear.

  • Competitive salary and equity — multiple options based on your desire for ownership.

  • Health benefits - We’ll cover health insurance premiums in your local country.

  • Fully-distributed culture — live and work where you'd like (EMEA time zones).

  • Company Off-site — company-paid off-site trips 🏖️.

  • Hardware setup — new MacBook(may include big display and other accessory stipends).

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Workable

Workable is East & Central Africa’s leading flexible workspace brand and the first in the region to achieve IFC EDGE green building certification. We create inspiring, sustainable work environments for entrepreneurs, corporates, and enterprise clients who want to “Love the Work.”

As we expand our footprint, we are looking for a dynamic Head of Sales to lead both inbound and outbound sales activities, ensuring we fill our spaces with ambitious, growing businesses.

Role Summary

The Head of Sales will be responsible for driving revenue growth by converting inbound leads, executing outbound prospecting, and managing the full sales cycle from enquiry to signed membership agreements. This role requires a proactive, results-driven individual who can balance structured B2B sales with relationship-based community selling.

Key Responsibilities

Inbound Sales (50%)

  • Handle all inbound leads from digital, referral, broker, and walk-in channels.

  • Conduct tours and presentations, tailoring solutions to client needs.

  • Manage pipeline in CRM, ensuring timely follow-up and high conversion.

  • Negotiate terms and close deals within pricing and margin guidelines.

Outbound Sales (50%)

  • Develop target lists for enterprise and SME clients in Nairobi and regional markets.

  • Run outreach campaigns via calls, email, LinkedIn, and networking events.

  • Build relationships with real estate brokers, consultants, and ecosystem partners.

  • Identify and pursue anchor tenants for enterprise suites.

Accountability & Reporting

  • Deliver against monthly desk occupancy and revenue targets.

  • Maintain accurate sales forecasts and pipeline reporting.

  • Track ROI on inbound channels and outbound campaigns.

  • Provide competitor and market intelligence to leadership.

Key Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or related field.

  • 5+ years’ B2B sales experience, preferably in real estate, coworking, hospitality, or premium services.

  • Proven track record in meeting/exceeding sales targets.

  • Strong negotiation, presentation, and relationship-building skills.

  • Tech-savvy with experience using CRM tools (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce).

  • Entrepreneurial spirit, self-starter, and comfortable in a fast-paced environment.

KPIs for Success

  • Desk occupancy % (private offices + enterprise suites).

  • Speed of lead response and conversion rates.

  • Outbound pipeline value generated monthly.

  • Client satisfaction post-move-in (NPS/feedback).

  • Broker & partner channel contribution.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary + performance-based incentives.

  • Opportunity to be part of a fast-growing, sustainability-driven brand.

  • Vibrant work environment in our flagship locations.

  • Growth opportunities as Workable scales across the region.

Sales Manager KPI Scorecard

1. Revenue & Occupancy (Primary KPIs)

  • Private Office Occupancy, ≥ 90% average, Across 17F + 18F

  • Enterprise Suites Occupancy, ≥ 85% average, Measure by ft² leased

  • Total Revenue Closed, [Set per budget], Memberships + add-on services

  • Average Deal Value, Track upward trend, Benchmark by desk/ft²

2. Sales Activity & Pipeline

  • Inbound Lead Response Time, < 2 hours, Speed to response = higher conversion

  • Lead-to-Tour Conversion, ≥ 60%, From inbound + broker leads

  • Tour-to-Sale Conversion, ≥ 30%, Aim higher for SMEs/enterprise

  • Outbound Prospecting Calls/Emails, 150–200 high-quality touches, Measured via CRM Outbound Pipeline Value Created, 3× quarterly sales target, Healthy pipeline multiple

3. Channel Performance

  • Broker Contribution, ≥ 25% of deals, Build broker network

  • Digital/Inbound Conversion, ≥ 20%, Paid + organic campaigns

  • Referrals & Partnerships, 10+ qualified leads, Leverage community & ecosystem

4. Client Experience & Retention

  • Client NPS (Net Promoter Score), ≥ 8.0, Collected post-move-in

  • Churn Rate (non-expiry exits), < 5%, Aim to reduce voluntary exits

  • Upsell/Cross-sell Revenue, ≥ 10%, of total Meeting rooms, event space, F&B

5. Reporting & Discipline

  • CRM Data Hygiene, 100% active deals updated weekly, No “ghost” deals

  • Forecast Accuracy, ±10% vs. actuals, Reliable reporting to leadership

  • Weekly Sales Reports, Submitted 100%, With key wins & risks

Quarterly Review Format

Weighting:

Revenue & Occupancy: 50%

Sales Activity & Pipeline: 25%

Client Experience & Retention: 15%

Reporting & Discipline: 10%

Scoring:

  • Exceeds = 120%+

  • Meets = 100%

  • Below = < 80%

jobs.title: Commercial Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Jackfruit Finance is Africa’s leading EdFinance platform empowering schools with affordable loans to expand classrooms, improve learning, and make education accessible to every child.

Role Overview:

The Commercial Manager is responsible for overseeing the firm’s day-to-day operational activities, ensuring efficient service delivery, and driving business growth by supporting customer acquisition and portfolio quality. Reporting to the CFO, this role is pivotal in implementing operational strategies, optimizing credit risk management, and leading field staff. The Commercial Manager will also be responsible for fostering a collaborative and productive environment across the company, with a commitment to maintaining high service standards, supporting a motivated team, and ensuring client satisfaction.

Key Responsibilities

  1. Strategic Operations Planning

    • Collaborate closely with the CFO to develop the institutional operations plan and define implementation strategies aligned with the firm’s goals.

  2. Risk Management

    • Work closely with the credit team to ensure effective credit risk mitigation strategies are in place, with all measures aligned to safeguard portfolio health.

  3. Business Growth

    • Drive business growth by leading customer acquisition initiatives and loan portfolio expansion while monitoring budget performance and achievement. Ensure all loans meet quality standards.

  4. Service Delivery Management

    • Oversee day-to-day service delivery to clients, identify areas for improvement, make recommendations, and lead implementation to enhance client satisfaction and service quality.

  5. Field Staff Recruitment and Training

    • Lead the recruitment, selection, and training of field staff, ensuring a skilled and motivated team.

  6. Team Development and Mentorship

    • Mentor, supervise, and train Team Leaders, building their competencies to drive business growth and maintain loan quality.

  7. Field Operations Coordination

    • Monitor and coordinate field activities, ensure completion of work plans, and provide logistical support for smooth field operations. Ensure the field team is adequately staffed and equipped.

  8. Performance Management

    • Implement performance management processes for all field staff, providing regular feedback and appraisals to foster accountability and drive performance.

  9. Loan Portfolio Quality

    • Maintain a healthy loan portfolio by closely monitoring loan repayment performance, ensuring timely interventions as needed.

  10. Staff Motivation and Engagement

    • Promote a positive and productive working environment for field staff, addressing any issues that could impact morale or performance.

  11. Cross-Functional Collaboration

    • Foster strong working relationships between the field team and other departments to support smooth operations and effective communication.

  12. Employee Relations

    • Address any staffing issues that may impact service delivery, ensuring that all employees are supported and aligned with the firm’s values.

  13. Client Complaint Management

    • Handle client complaints professionally, ensuring timely feedback and resolution to maintain high client satisfaction.

  14. Marketing Planning and Strategy Oversight

    • Oversee the planning and execution of marketing activities in collaboration with the marketing team, ensuring alignment with operational goals and customer acquisition targets.

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):

  1. Loan Disbursements

    • Percentage achievement against planned disbursements.

  2. Loan Book Growth

    • Total loan book volume achieved, with specific targets for portfolio growth.

  3. Portfolio At Risk (PAR) over 30 Days

    • Maintain a PAR (Portfolio At Risk) of under 5% for loans over 30 days past due.

  4. Staff Performance Appraisal

    • Complete quarterly and annual performance appraisals for all field staff, with 75% of the field team meeting or exceeding performance benchmarks.

jobs.title: Chief Operating Officer (COO)/Deputy CEO
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Pezesha

Pezesha is a pioneering fintech company building scalable, responsible, and data-driven financial infrastructure for MSMEs across Africa. We are entering a critical growth phase with expansion plans across new markets, partnerships, and investor engagement. As we continue this upward trajectory, we are looking for a Chief Operating Officer (COO) who is not only operationally excellent but deeply aligned with our mission and vision.

About the role

The COO will serve as the right hand to the CEO—functioning as Deputy CEO—responsible for driving flawless execution of Pezesha’s growth roadmap, enforcing operational rigor, and aligning cross-functional teams for high performance. This is a strategic and execution-focused leadership role, ideal for a builder with a proven track record of scaling operations and leading teams in fast-paced, high-growth environments.

The ideal candidate will lead day-to-day operations, guide department heads, tackle company-wide challenges, and foster cohesion across all business units. As a trusted partner to the CEO, the COO will play a key role in turning vision into action.

Key Responsibilities

Strategic Operations & Execution

  • Co-develop and implement Pezesha’s long-term operating plan with the CEO and CFO, ensuring alignment with the company’s financial model and strategic roadmap.

  • Translate the LT plan into short-term (quarterly and annual) departmental plans, ensuring performance targets and KPIs are cascaded and executed across all countries.

  • Independently lead cross-functional strategic initiatives with a strong grasp of company-wide priorities.

  • Serve as the CEO’s proxy and sounding board in decision-making, driving forward execution with the same urgency and ownership as the Founder.

  • Build, refine, and scale internal processes for operational efficiency, visibility, and accountability.

Leadership & People Management

  • Oversee and lead all credit operations, including origination, underwriting, disbursement, collection, and portfolio performance across multiple markets.

  • Ensure credit operations are efficient, data-driven, and aligned with risk, compliance, and business growth objectives.

  • Mentor and guide credit leadership and ensure strong feedback loops between credit, risk, product, and tech teams.

  • Lead and mentor department heads to ensure they are resourced, focused, and held accountable for performance and strategic alignment.

  • Run weekly leadership meetings with all leads to monitor progress, resolve challenges, and ensure interdepartmental collaboration.

Business Growth & Financial Oversight

  • Collaborate with the CEO on business development, partner relationships, and strategic investor engagement.

  • Support execution of key fundraising initiatives and contribute to expansion strategy.

  • Work with the CFO to track cash flow, budgets, and ensure financial discipline across departments.

  • Proactively manage risks, costs, and ensure operational resilience.

Founder Support & Organizational Glue

  • Actively relieve the CEO of day-to-day execution burdens and tactical decisions, allowing focus on vision, investors, and talent growth.

  • Own internal communication and coordination, ensuring all teams are aligned and motivated.

  • Ensure issues are escalated and resolved promptly, often being the first to spot fires before they become crises.

  • Champion the company culture in every aspect—from new hires to leadership cohesion.

Who You Are

Key Qualities & Expectations

  • Trusted Partner to the CEO: You have a high degree of integrity, emotional intelligence, and business maturity. You offer candid advice and bring solutions, not noise.

  • Charismatic Leader: Leads by example and earns the respect of the leadership team. Seen as the company’s center of gravity when the CEO is absent.

  • Execution-Oriented: Moves quickly and decisively. Doesn’t wait to be told what to do and thrives on solving high-stakes problems.

  • Growth Driver: Aggressively drives the achievement of operational KPIs and business targets. No tolerance for lagging performance.

  • Operational Strategist: Combines big-picture thinking with hands-on implementation. Understands how to turn strategy into results.

  • People Champion: Connects with teams at all levels. Seen as approachable, supportive, and empathetic, while also firm on accountability.

  • Financially Savvy: Understands the financial levers of the business and can drive spending discipline and return on investment across operations.

  • Highly Adaptive: Grows with the company, ready to evolve responsibilities as Pezesha enters new stages of growth.

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 7+ years in senior operational or strategic leadership roles in fintech, startups, or high-growth ventures.

  • Strong understanding of African markets and operating in dynamic regulatory and economic environments.

  • Proven track record in managing cross-functional teams and scaling business operations.

  • Demonstrated success in budget oversight, financial analysis, and business planning.

  • Experience working closely with founders and/or holding P&L responsibility.

  • Advanced degree in Business, Finance, Operations, or related field preferred.

  • Previous startup equity-holder or co-founder experience is a major plus.

What Success Looks Like (First 12 Months)

  • Execution of a clear operating plan aligned with Pezesha’s strategic goals and investor expectations. 4

  • All departments are operating with increased efficiency, clarity, and accountability.

  • Reduced dependency on the CEO for operational decisions.

  • Strong internal culture of performance, discipline, and execution.

  • Strategic expansion plans are underway with robust operational systems in place

Why Join Pezesha?

  • Drive real impact: Join a mission-driven team working to unlock financial inclusion for MSMEs across Africa.
    Work with visionary leadership: Collaborate closely with our CEO and dynamic leadership team shaping the future of embedded finance.

  • Lead with purpose: Take ownership of high-stakes decisions that directly influence strategy, growth, and innovation.

  • Grow into leadership: Fast-track your career toward a C-level role with meaningful equity (ESOP) and the opportunity to build lasting impact.

jobs.title: Business Controller
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

We are dedicated to fostering upward social mobility in diverse communities by providing credit access to entrepreneurs who are often excluded from traditional banking. Through a combination of asset financing, fintech innovations, AI-based underwriting, and proprietary car portals, we empower local entrepreneurs, such as motorcycle taxi riders, Uber/Bolt drivers, and small business owners, to purchase their own vehicles and obtain loans to expand their businesses.

About the Role

We are looking for a Business & Financial Controller to help achieve profitable growth in this fast-developing market.

Relocation to Nairobi, Kenya is required.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with Business Leaders, Data Analytics, Accounting, and Financial Control teams to design and lead business controls that ensure optimal operational and cost management practices.

  • Lead the budgeting, forecasting, and projection processes while ensuring alignment with key performance indicators (KPIs) for all departments.

  • Initiate and manage cross-functional projects to integrate cost control planning into decision-making and address identified risks and operational improvements, including inventory management, contract management, procurement, vendor management, and accounts payable processes.

  • Identify and assess operational risks, providing actionable recommendations for risk mitigation.

  • Support business teams with data analyses to pinpoint areas for improvement, efficiency enhancements, and cost optimization opportunities.

  • Ambitions to grow into the country’s COO and CFO role.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).

  • 3-5 years of experience in consulting, audit or a similar field.

  • Strong analytical and strategic thinking capabilities.

  • Commercial awareness and business acumen.

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

What We Offer:

  • A prime opportunity to establish an impactful business control practice that is vital for scaling the business.

  • The chance to lead change and enhance operations in a low-bureaucracy environment.

  • An approachable and resourceful management team.

  • A multicultural and professional team dynamic.

  • A friendly and dynamic workplace.

  • Salary ranging from EUR 2500 to EUR 4000 per month before taxes, results-oriented bonus system

  • Housing allowance (up to 1000 EUR) and periodic flights back to home country.

  • Relocation support (flights to Nairobi, visas)

  • Health insurance

Impact: Build the foundation and shape engineering practices, team, and company culture.

Excellence: Practice your craft with other ICs in a well-organized, fast-paced environment.

Ownership: Influence the direction of the product and strategy — we care about your opinions.

  • Analyze product requirements, propose, and deliver the best possible solutions

  • Lead software development projects

  • Document and record every aspect of an application or software

  • Plan, track, and schedule software deliverables

  • Research and propose new apps and products

  • Provide support during the entire application development process

  • Troubleshoot and debug apps before handing them over to testers for better performance

  • Update the tech stack according to latest technology trends

  • Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.

  • Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs.

  • Maintain code integrity and organization.

  • Portfolio of successfully released applications

About Us

We are dedicated to fostering upward social mobility in diverse communities by providing credit access to entrepreneurs who are often excluded from traditional banking. Mogo Kenya is expanding into smartphone and device financing and is seeking a strategic, execution-driven Head of Operations to lead and scale our operational function. This role will be responsible for building operational processes, ensuring seamless execution across sales, dealer management, customer care, and debt collection, and preparing the business for rapid growth.

About The Role

The Head of Operations will play a key role in ensuring customer success, strong debt collection practices, and operational excellence, driving both efficiency and quality across the business.

Relocation to Nairobi, Kenya is required.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Strategy & Alignment

    • Define and implement an operational strategy to support the launch and scale-up of device financing.

    • Drive continuous process improvements to maximize efficiency and minimize risk.

    • Partner with the Risk team to enforce robust fraud prevention and customer verification processes.

    • Ensure all processes comply with company policies and local regulations.

  • Customer Experience & Performance

    • Ensure customer experience is positive throughout the financing journey, from onboarding to repayment.

    • Oversee and strengthen debt collection processes, working closely with Mogo’s existing DC team to minimize defaults.

    • Monitor KPIs related to customer satisfaction, churn, repayment rates, and default management.

  • Team Leadership & Development

    • Build frameworks for training and onboarding to ensure rapid productivity of new hires.

    • Foster a culture of accountability, collaboration, and performance excellence.

  • Experience working with dealers, distributors, or large partner networks.

  • Strong leadership and people management skills; experience managing mid-level managers and large teams.

  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.

  • Ability to balance strategic vision with hands-on execution in a startup/scale-up environment.

  • Strong stakeholder management and cross-functional collaboration skills.

  • Prior experience with process digitization and CRM/ERP systems.

  • Fluency in additional local languages.

  • A multicultural and professional team dynamic.

  • Competitive monthly salary and results-oriented bonus system

  • Housing allowance and periodic flights back to home country.

  • Relocation support (flights to Nairobi, visas)

  • Health insurance

About the Company

Advance Insight (founded in May 2021) is an internationally recognised Odoo Gold Partner, awarded Best Odoo Partner Africa in 2023 and 2024 (and nominated again in 2025). We support African SMEs (small and medium enterprises) with their digital transformation. How? By implementing the Odoo ERP system and customising it to our clients’ needs.

We currently have a team of 15 Odoo experts (and growing) with offices in Kenya and the Netherlands. We prefer to work for clients in high-impact sectors—such as agriculture, circular economy, energy, and health—with complex digitalisation needs.

In less than four years, we have grown our portfolio to 50+ clients in 30+ (predominantly African) countries, including several multi-national companies. Our own product portfolio includes 25+ custom products fully integrated into Odoo.

We intend to double in size over the next twelve months and seek a Growth Lead to enhance the growth of our client base and project pipeline. You will work alongside and report to the Director(s).

Input: What you are going to do

As the Growth Lead, you will be responsible for the commercial growth of Advance Insight in two areas:

Revenue from new customers

  • In collaboration with the Directors, you define the enterprise Sales strategy and go-to-market plan for the coming period, including revenue targets, target customers, geographies, and sales channels.

  • You manage the sales process end-to-end, from lead generation (inbound and outbound) to closing the deal based on the sales strategy.

  • Where necessary, you improve the sales process, tools and templates.

  • The directors are available to support and help close deals; however, we seek someone who drives and oversees the entire sales process.

Revenue from existing customers

  • You define the upsell strategy and plan with the Directors and the Head of Projects.

  • You are responsible for the upsell process and results, from identifying the upsell opportunity to the proposal to closing the deal with a contract.

  • You provide input on marketing, product offering and development, pricing, customer onboarding, and customer success where necessary.

Output: When you are successful

Sales KPIs that are important to us:

  • Sold scopings (paid project to assess client needs): >1 a month

  • Success rate scopings: 100%

  • Contracted revenue from new customers (~70% of total revenue): 100% growth year on year.

  • Contracted revenue from existing customers (~30%of total revenue): 100% growth year on year

Core competencies: What you are good at

  • Result-driven: You are super result-driven and always looking for ways to grow commercial results for your organisation.

  • Business partner: You can collaborate with customers on their digitisation strategy and how Odoo would benefit them, building strong relationships during the process.

  • Organised: You build and follow an enterprise sales cycle diligently.

  • Eye for detail: Your communication (products) are of high quality and C-suite worthy.

  • Excellent communicator: You can read between the lines and know when to listen. Your English is perfect, both written and spoken.

Experience: What experience can you fall back on

  • You have a proven track record in enterprise sales for at least 8 years

  • Experience selling Odoo, another ERP or a related digital enterprise product is preferred

  • Ideally, you have done sales in Africa and preferably to international companies and or international owners

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify client needs and recommend appropriate solutions. If you have consulting experience, that would be great

  • You have worked within international teams

  • Think & work at the level of a Master’s degree

  • Start-up and or scale-up experience is a preference

Core values translated to your role

Ownership

We own our responsibilities end to end; we drive our professional development; we acquire the knowledge required for our work.

Growth

We keep on learning, evolving and growing, both individually and as a company.

Curiosity

We don't take anything at face value; we want to know the why and how and become better at what we do.

Principle over pressure

We stand our ground when we believe in our approach, even in the face of pushback from clients, colleagues, or management. But we’re open to feedback and always willing to adjust course when challenged.

We've got your back

Internally and externally, we are dependable partners. We keep our word, stay committed to shared goals, and support each other to get the job done - as a team.

Practical information

Contract type: Full-time

Start date: Preferably 1 November 2025 or sooner

Location: Nairobi, with occasional travel

About the Company

Share is a decentralized internet service provider in Africa that turns every roof and balcony into its own internet distribution central, allowing individuals to connect and earn to a fast, unlimited and community-owned Wi-Fi service.

Share is on a mission to democratize access to the internet service economy. Similar to what the solar panel industry did for energy, Share is providing a solution for broadband.

About the Role

We’re looking for a Senior Network Engineer to be based locally in Kenya. This role is focused on designing, deploying, and operating ISP networks across fiber, routing and switching, and wireless access. You’ll take ownership of our first metro fiber deployments (GPON, XGS-PON, and Active Optical Networks), manage backbone routing and switching, and integrate last-mile wireless access (PtP, PtMP) into the stack.

This is a high-impact position for someone who wants to help build the technical backbone of Africa’s next-generation ISP.

Key Responsibilities

  • Network Engineering (primary focus)

  • Plan, deploy, and maintain fiber networks (GPON, XGS-PON, AON) and integration with aggregation/core.

  • Configure and manage ISP network infrastructure (routing, switching, wireless, NAT/CGNAT, RADIUS).

  • Establish and optimize BGP/OSPF/MPLS peering with upstream providers.

  • Deploy and optimize PtP and PtMP radios and network gear (MikroTik, Juniper, Cambium, etc.).

  • Monitor network performance and troubleshoot outages/degradations proactively.

  • Implement firewall, QoS, DHCP, and IPAM solutions.

  • Ensure scalability and reliability of PoPs and backbone interconnects.

Must Have

  • Strong background in fiber network deployments (GPON, XGS-PON, or AON).

  • Familiarity with network hardware (MikroTik, Juniper, Ubiquiti, Cambium, etc.).

  • Skilled in troubleshooting with tools like tcpdump, Wireshark, iperf.

Nice to Have

  • Familiarity with WISP-specific environments and radios.

  • Knowledge of IPv6 planning and dual-stack deployments.

  • Scripting in Bash, Python, or Golang.

  • A chance to help build Africa’s next-generation ISP from the ground up.

  • Competitive salary and equity in a mission-driven, investor-backed company.

  • Private health and wellness benefits (discussed during the interview process).

  • A steep learning curve, high ownership, and the ability to make a lasting impact.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About AMI

The African Management Institute (AMI) enables ambitious businesses across Africa to thrive by driving growth and building future-ready teams. Through practical and scalable learning, AMI empowers managers and entrepreneurs with the tools and skills to drive performance and results. Our clients range from ambitious SMEs to large enterprises and development partners working to catalyse change in African markets.

About the Role

AMI is looking for a Business Development Manager to join our growing team in Nigeria. This role is ideal for a high-performing B2B sales professional who thrives on building relationships, meeting revenue targets, and contributing to the growth of a purpose-driven organization. You’ll be responsible for identifying and converting new business opportunities with enterprise and growth-stage clients. You'll work closely with the Nigeria Country Lead and cross-functional teams to shape and execute strategic sales plans, leveraging your network and understanding of the business landscape in Nigeria.

Key Responsibilities

  • Identify, qualify, and convert new business opportunities with enterprise and development sector clients.

  • Own the end-to-end sales process, from prospecting and pitching to negotiation and closing.

jobs.title: Finance Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Craydel

At Craydel, we believe in the power of education to transform lives and create opportunities. Our mission is to democratize access to quality higher education for students and working professionals in Sub-Saharan Africa.

We exist because we know that education should not be a privilege reserved for the few, but a right available to everyone, regardless of their background or location. We have helped over 100, 000 students find the right university and currently provide access to 500+ universities in 40+ study destinations around the globe.

Our commitment is to ensure that every student/working professional has the chance to achieve their educational and professional goals.

Mission Statement

Build a high‑integrity, insight‑driven finance function that enables Craydel to achieve enrollment and growth goals through data-driven decisions, while maintaining rigorous controls and compliance.

Team

You will lead a team of one mid‑level accountant and two junior accountants. Your focus is to:

  • Take ownership for the deliverables of the Finance department

  • Oversee the team’s day‑to‑day work quality and deadlines

  • Continuously improve and automate finance processes and controls

  • Focus on strategic finance (e.g. delivering actionable insights for faster, better decisions) and complex, high impact activities (e.g. cross-border tax structuring)

What You’ll Do

  • Financial operations and controls (oversee)

    • Oversee monthly close, reconciliations, and management accounts, supported by team of two to three accountants

    • Ensure timely, accurate audits, tax computations and filings. Maintain a clean document trail

    • Oversee statutory filings and compliance across all markets (currently, 6 countries)

  • A/R and collections (oversee)

    • Tighten invoicing, collections, and partner settlements for greater accuracy and faster collections

  • FP&A and decision support (implement and oversee)

    • Build and maintain rolling forecasts, budgets, and variance analyses for P&L, KPIs and cash

    • Prepare monthly finance packs, board materials, and fundraising data requests

    • Translate numbers into insights and actions for leadership

  • Cash and treasury (own)

    • Own cash flow forecasting and runway planning

  • Systems and process improvement (own)

    • Improve the chart of accounts, close checklist, and SOPs. Drive automation in accounting and reporting

    • Evaluate and implement finance tools to reduce manual work and error rates

  • Risk Management & Governance (own)

    • Identify and mitigate financial risks, including FX, tax, and regulatory exposure across countries

    • Strengthen internal controls and anti-fraud frameworks

  • Admin and HR operations (oversee)

    • Oversee admin activities including office leases, office purchases, sharing of offer letters, etc.

  • Leadership & Team Development (own)

    • Develop and mentor the finance team (currently 3 accountants) to support growth

Qualifications

  • CPA or ACCA qualified, or equivalent professional certification

  • 5-10 years of progressive finance experience, including ownership of FP&A

  • Experience in a high‑growth startup or scale‑up environment with lean teams

  • Highly organized. Detail‑obsessed with checklists and trackers. This is a must!

  • Advanced Excel skills. Comfortable with financial modeling and scenario analysis

  • Excellent written and spoken communication. Clear and structured

  • Track record of managing a team and getting the best of your direct reports to meet KPIs and deadlines

  • Love using AI in your work and personal life

  • Entrepreneurial self‑starter who owns outcomes, meets deadlines, and asks for help when needed

  • Unwavering integrity and a strong moral compass. Passionate about Craydel’s mission

Craydel’s Values

1) We are learner-obsessed

We put learners first in everything we do.

2) We do more with less

We stretch ourselves and our budgets to accomplish more with less.

3) We think in solutions

We know there are many obstacles in building a world-class start-up. That’s why we commit to identifying potential solutions every time we face a challenge.

4) We are performance-driven

We hold ourselves accountable to achieve our KPIs.

5) We are stronger together

We know that while each activity has an owner, we all depend on each other to achieve our key results.

Craydel’s Anti-Values (Who We are Not)

  1. We are not a 9 to 5 organization. We have to do whatever it takes to get the job done. Putting learners first often means meeting them on evenings and weekends.

  2. We are not a remote culture. All departments must work closely together to achieve our goals, so we value in-person collaboration.

  3. We do not make excuses. If something isn’t getting done, we do it ourselves.

About Leta.ai

Leta.ai are building the operating system for logistics in Africa. Leta is an AI-powered delivery management platform that helps businesses reduce costs, improve efficiency, and deliver faster. Leta is operating in 6+ countries across Africa and growing. They are trusted by leading brands like Diageo, KFC, Decathlon, Gilanis and they recently raised $5m from investors such as Google Ventures, Speedinvest, and Equator.

Role Overview

You’ll work closely with our executive team and key internal and external stakeholders to shape critical projects that drive growth, partnerships, and true scale. You’ll be working across teams internally and externally to deliver measurable outcomes.

Initial Mandate:

  • Google Partnership: Deepen relationships with Google’s product and investment teams (Maps, Routing, Africa Fund) to maximize current investment value and keep them engaged for future rounds.

  • Fintech Layer: Explore opportunities to integrate fintech across our platform to drive stickiness and value for customers, including rider wallets and payouts, supply chain and asset financing (fuel, phones, bikes), and other innovative solutions.

  • Clean Energy Layer: Identify opportunities with EV providers (e.g., Greenwheels, ARC) for DSP adoption, carbon tracking, ESG reporting, and operational margin improvements.

  • Planned Deliveries Product-Market Fit: Support the Product Manager to unlock commercial PMF and deliver the “aha” moments for our customers and their stakeholders (finance, ops, C-suite).

  • KFC Commercial Strategy: Partner with me on deal strategy, negotiations, and structuring for Africa-wide expansion.

  • AI Infrastructure and Applications: Explore ways to implement AI across the business, in data, technology, operations and customer service, and sales to improve efficiency, insights, and decision-making.

This is just the start. You will play a key role on strategic initiatives to help the country scale across Africa and beyond, optimising logistics, cutting costs and reducing carbon emissions for some of the continent's biggest companies. We are looking for a generalist who can shape strategy, execute and quickly adapt to new challenges.

Desired Profile:

This role is likely to be a good fit for someone with a background in strategy. This could be from consulting, investment or similar professional services experience, or you could have run strategic projects for another high-growth company. However, we are not prescriptive about the exact background of the applicant.

The role would require a minimum of 3 years experience FTE.

jobs.title: Business Development Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
The Business Development Executive will drive the growth of OKOA’s B2B rescue and maintenance services by spearheading the acquisition of new customers and institutional partners across East Africa. This role combines hands-on sales execution with strategic leadership in product positioning. The ideal candidate is both a relationship-builder and a storyteller—someone who can identify market opportunities, communicate the value proposition effectively, and close high-impact deals.

They will own the sales pipeline from prospecting through to closing, develop compelling sales materials, and represent OKOA at meetings with prospective partners. Additionally, the Lead will shape OKOA’s market positioning strategy—ensuring the company is positioned with clarity, credibility, and consistency across all external-facing touchpoints.

This position reports directly to the CEO and will play a central role in achieving the company’s ambitious growth target.

Key Responsibilities:

  1. Customer Pipeline Development & Lead Generation

    • Identify, prioritize, and engage with B2B client segments (e.g. fleet operators, logistics firms, saccos, FMCG fleets…etc.)

    • Use targeted outreach methods (calls, email, referrals, network intros) to build a high-quality lead pipeline.

    • Track all opportunities in CRM; ensure quick turnaround from lead to first meeting.

  2. Sales Process Execution & Closing

    • Lead the end-to-end sales cycle: from initial contact to needs assessment, proposal, negotiation, and deal close.

    • Execute on custom proposals, SLAs, and MOUs using internal templates.

    • Set and track KPIs like pipeline conversion rate, deal velocity (e.g. <21 days to close), and referral-driven growth.

  3. Sales Positioning Development

    • Create and continually refine sales decks, one-pagers, case studies, and product FAQs.

    • Work closely with the Customer Success teams to ensure consistency across all client-facing material.

    • Refine key messaging, positioning, and storytelling frameworks

    • Maintain a database of up-to-date sales documents and templates.

  4. Partnership Development

    • Work with the CEO to identify and develop strategic ecosystem partners (e.g., OEMs, Insurance companies).

    • Identify and position OKOA to target key distribution channels, such as regional B2B platforms, widening OKOA’s reach.

  5. Sales Intelligence

    • Set up mechanisms to gather and synthesize feedback from lost/won deals and prospective clients.

    • Share intelligence with Management, Customer Success and Ops teams to improve product-market fit.

    • Ensure all insights are translated into sales strategies and material updates.

  6. Performance Monitoring & Reporting

    • Prepare weekly and monthly dashboards to report on sales performance, bottlenecks, and new opportunities.

    • Monitor OKRs such as customer acquisition targets, referral rates, NPS, and sales pipeline health.

Qualifications & Skills

Experience: 3+ years of experience in B2B business development in East Africa, ideally in logistics, mobility, or shipping.

Required Skills:

  • Exceptional Communication and Relationship-Building Skills.

  • Strong strategic thinking skills with an ability to analyze market trends and anticipate industry shifts to guide business strategy.

  • Strong storytelling and proposal-writing skills.

  • Ability to take informed data-driven decisions.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Craydel

At Craydel, we believe in the power of education to transform lives and create opportunities. Our mission is to democratize access to quality higher education for students and working professionals in Sub-Saharan Africa.

We exist because we know that education should not be a privilege reserved for the few, but a right available to everyone, regardless of their background or location. We have helped over 100, 000 students find the right university and currently provide access to 500+ universities in 40+ study destinations around the globe.

Our commitment is to ensure that every student/working professional has the chance to achieve their educational and professional goals.

Mission Statement

To build strategic university relationships that drive enrollments (Craydel's North Star Metric) and deliver value to Craydel’s learners

What You’ll Do

  • Secure value from university partners (e.g. sponsorships for events, volume-based incentives, etc.)

  • Deliver value to university partners (e.g. share monthly insights, organize trainings, etc.)

  • Drive operational excellence (e.g. escalate challenges from Craydel’s Admissions team, provide regular updates on applicants, etc.)

  • Enable Product and Marketing (e.g. document unique university value propositions)

  • Expand strategically (e.g. identify and sign universities with current or projected demand)

Qualifications

  • You have 2+ years of work experience in a fast-paced, high-pressure work environment such as a start-up

  • You have experience studying and living abroad (outside of Africa) - this is a must-have!

  • You have excellent communication skills

  • You are great at building relationships and thinking on your feet. You have no problem making small talk with people you’ve never met before and make a great first impression

  • You are very organized and thrive on creating and updating trackers

  • You are curious and love getting and implementing feedback

  • You are a self-starter who can take ownership and deliver results with limited supervision

  • You are an entrepreneur at heart and have led your own business or side hustle

  • You are passionate about Craydel’s mission and are motivated by helping learners

  • Note: You do not require any prior experience in the industry

Craydel’s Values

1) We are learner-obsessed

We put learners first in everything we do.

2) We do more with less

We stretch ourselves and our budgets to accomplish more with less.

3) We think in solutions

We know there are many obstacles in building a world-class start-up. That’s why we commit to identifying potential solutions every time we face a challenge.

4) We are performance-driven

We hold ourselves accountable to achieve our KPIs.

5) We are stronger together

We know that while each activity has an owner, we all depend on each other to achieve our key results.

Craydel’s Anti-Values (Who We are Not)

  1. We are not a 9 to 5 organization. We have to do whatever it takes to get the job done. Putting learners first often means meeting them on evenings and weekends.

  2. We are not a remote culture. All departments must work closely together to achieve our goals, so we value in-person collaboration.

  3. We do not make excuses. If something isn’t getting done, we do it ourselves.
